questions.question_text: When reviewing a third-party agreement with a cloud service provider, which of the following should be the GREATEST concern regarding customer data privacy?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
When reviewing a third-party agreement with a cloud service provider, the greatest concern regarding customer data privacy is typically the "Return or destruction of information." 

This concern is crucial because the agreement needs to ensure that the cloud service provider will properly handle customer data at the end of the contract or when the data is no longer needed. Proper return or destruction mechanisms are essential to prevent unauthorized access, data leaks, or retention beyond the agreed-upon period, which can lead to privacy breaches and non-compliance with data protection regulations. Therefore, ensuring that the provider has clear, secure, and compliant procedures for returning or destroying data is paramount for safeguarding customer privacy.
I think the answer is D, as data privacy would be compromised in the event of network intrusion. A and C look more like availability.

Selected Answer: C
Due to the high availability goals of a CSP, the command to delete sensitive data may not result in full destruction. Also, due to the customer’s limited visibility of the environment, the customer’s command to delete the data might be inadequate. These are relevant compliance risk scenarios to consider, together with appropriate preventive or detective controls that the CSP adopts. CCAK P# 55

Selected Answer: C
I am changing my original response. The answer to the question is C. Return or destruction of information should be the greatest concern regarding customer data privacy when reviewing a third-party agreement with a cloud service provider. This information can be found on page 107 of the Certificate of Cloud Auditing Knowledge Study Guide.

"Return or destruction of information: The agreement should specify how customer data will be returned or destroyed at the end of the contract term or upon request by the customer." 

This implies that return or destruction of information is an important consideration for customer data privacy when reviewing a third-party agreement with a cloud service provider.

Selected Answer: A
Answer A.

choices.A: decrease the interval between attestations of compliance.
choices.B: combine point-in-time assurance approaches with continuous monitoring.
choices.D: combine point-in-time assurance approaches with continuous auditing.
choices.C: increase the frequency of external audits from annual to quarterly.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The answer to the question is D. The best way to deliver continuous compliance in a cloud environment is to combine point-in-time assurance approaches with continuous auditing. This information can be found on page 319 of the Certificate of Cloud Auditing Knowledge Study Guide.

"None of the static approaches to compliance can give assurance of what could happen one day after the audit is finalized... depending on the level of assurance the cloud customer requests, a different approach might be required, based on continuous auditing." 

This implies that combining point-in-time assurance approaches with continuous auditing would provide the best way to deliver continuous compliance in a cloud environment.

Selected Answer: B
The BEST way to deliver continuous compliance in a cloud environment is:

**B. combine point-in-time assurance approaches with continuous monitoring.**

Combining point-in-time assurance approaches with continuous monitoring is the most effective method for ensuring ongoing compliance in a dynamic cloud environment. Point-in-time assurance provides a snapshot of compliance at a specific moment, while continuous monitoring enables real-time oversight of compliance status and can quickly identify any deviations or issues as they occur. This combination allows an organization to maintain a proactive stance, addressing compliance requirements dynamically and adjusting to changes in the cloud environment. It is more efficient than simply increasing the frequency of audits or attestations, which might not capture ongoing changes and risks effectively.

Selected Answer: D
D. combine point-in-time assurance approaches with continuous auditing.

questions.question_text: Which of the following standards is designed to be used by organizations for cloud services that intend to select controls within the process of implementing an Information Security Management System based on ISO/IEC 27001?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is:

**A. ISO/IEC 27017:2015**

ISO/IEC 27017:2015 is specifically designed to provide guidelines for information security controls applicable to cloud services, and it complements the implementation of an Information Security Management System (ISMS) based on ISO/IEC 27001. It offers additional cloud-specific guidance beyond the general controls outlined in ISO/IEC 27001 and ISO/IEC 27002, helping organizations select and apply controls tailored to cloud environments.

Selected Answer: A
The ISO/IEC 27001 standard is broadly applicable to any organization, because it provides a specification for an Information Security Management System (ISMS). ISO/IEC 27002 describes controls that can be put in place to adhere to the ISO/IEC 27001 standard. Further building on these foundational pieces, ISO published ISO/IEC 27017, which provides guidance on the information security aspects of cloud computing, recommending and assisting with the implementation of cloud-specific information security controls supplementing the guidance in ISO/IEC 27002. CCAK P# 134
A: ISO/IEC 27017:2015 - Code of practice for information security controls based on ISO/IEC 27002 for cloud services

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the common cause of misconfiguration in a cloud environment?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The common cause of misconfiguration in a cloud environment is:

**A. Absence of effective change control**

Effective change control processes are crucial for managing configurations in a cloud environment. Without proper change control, unauthorized or incorrect changes can be made to cloud resources, leading to misconfigurations. These misconfigurations can result in security vulnerabilities, compliance issues, or operational disruptions. Ensuring robust change control helps maintain the integrity of cloud configurations and reduces the risk of errors. Using multiple cloud service providers, new cloud computing techniques, and traditional change process mechanisms can contribute to complexity, but the absence of effective change control is a direct cause of misconfiguration.

Selected Answer: A
CCC-03–Quality Testing—Quality change control and testing are established for application misconfigurations affecting the confidentiality, integrity and availability of the systems and services. CCAK P# 247
